title: Barbara Windsor makes rare public appearance to wish Chris Evans good luck with charity marathon

Dame Barbara Windsor has made a rare public appearance as she battles with Alzheimer's disease.

The 82-year-old EastEnders actress filmed a video wishing good luck to her friend Chris Evans, who is running a marathon in Amsterdam.

He's doing this to raise money for Dementia Revolution, a campaign set up set up by the Alzheimer' Society, of which husband Scott is an ambassador.

(Image: Internet Unknown)

Barbara, who played Peggy Mitchell in the BBC soap, surprised Chris with a touching message in the video.

"Hello darlings, Barbara Windsor here", she said.

"Thank you all for donating so much money to Dementia Revolution. Your generosity will support vital research that will give hope to people living with the condition.

(Image: Getty Images)

"Dementia is the biggest health threat facing society. There are nearly one million people living with the condition in the UK and another person is diagnosed every three minutes."

Barbara was diagnosed with the degenerative condition in 2014.

She continued: "As you run through the streets of Amsterdam remember, you're leading the charge towards finding the cure for dementia.

(Image: BBC)

"I may not be with you in person but I will be with you in spirit every step of the way. Good luck and God bless you."

The live charity auction of VIP places at the Amsterdam Marathon took place on Chris Evans' Virgin Radio show in August

It raised over £400,000 for Dementia Revolution.
description: The EastEnders actress surprised Chris Evans with a touching message of support as he raises money for her husband's dementia charity
